text: Vicki A. Saporta has been the president of the National Abortion Federation since 1995. In 2013, she received the Roger Baldwin Medal of Liberty from the ACLU. ==Biography== Saporta was born and raised in Rochester, New York, and graduated from Cornell University in 1974. She went on to study at the London School of Economics, and later served as director of organizing for the International Brotherhood of Teamsters beginning in 1983. For over 20 years, Vicki was the president of the National Abortion Federation until she resigned https://prochoice.org/vicki-saporta-to-retire/ after being accused of not taking action when an employee was guilty of sexual harassment. https://rewire.news/article/2018/06/14/employees-say-national-reproductive- rights-organization-failed-address-claims-sexual-harassment/ ==References== ==External links== *About Vicki Saporta Category:Living people Category:Activists from Rochester, New York Category:American abortion-rights activists Category:Cornell University alumni Category:American women activists Category:International Brotherhood of Teamsters people Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:American women trade unionists Category:Alumni of the London School of Economics
title: Vicki Saporta
